channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report I-2023090069
item.description:
Report I-2023090069

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It appears that the shipment was punctured by a forklift upon moving into the truck for transport (after being flown). It was not noticed until the next day when it was to be picked up. Agent tried to clean up and inhaled the stuff, was advised to go to hospital to be checked out and was kept for observation- OSHA - inhalation warning. Shipment was cleaned up by a HAZMAT team • AWB#75875343- 28-piece shipment- split between two flights 928/959 on 8/31/23.• 4 pieces on 928, 24 pieces on 959• Shipment was placed on reefer truck on 8/31• Driver came to pick up shipment on 9/2 around 1300, noticed the powder, and immediately refused to pick up shipment.• Faro Employee Leticia Alvarez went to investigate and began to try to clean up the area. UA management advised at the time• Hazchem on site at 6pm for cleanup, 3 damaged boxes removed after clean up due to punctures in the boxes and leaking. Hazchem contact: Allan Mandell 330 S.Fairbank Street Addison IL (630} • Attempted to contact local environmental coordinator at 2:20pm

item.title: Report X-2023090225
item.description:
Report X-2023090225

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO THREE PACKAGES THAT WERE WET AND FALLING APART DUE TO THE CONDENSATION FROM DRY ICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING DOG FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z0956E2P126741435 AND 1Z0956E2P136090503.

item.title: Report X-2023090481
item.description:
Report X-2023090481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A PACKAGE THAT SUPERVISOR DESCRIBED AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION IN FULL PPE, TO FIND A PACKAGE IN THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE THAT WAS LEAKING A DARK LIQUID. RESPONDER USED PH TAPE ON THE LIQUID, AND IT READ A PH OF 0. THIS LED RESPONDER TO USE THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET, AND RESPONDER NEUTRALIZED THE LIQUID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER THEN RETESTED THE PH OF THE MATERIAL, AND GOT A 6. RESPONDER FINISHED CLEANING THE VEHICLE WITH ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE PACKAGE AND SPILL MATERIAL IN SPILL TUBS. WHILE RESPONDER WAS FINISHING THE CLEAN UP IN THE VEHCLE, CALLED ADDITIONAL RESPONDER TO ASSIST RESPONDER IN TRANSPORTING ALL THE MATERIAL BACK TO THE DMP. DURING THE TIME OF MOVING THE PACKAGE ONTO A SPILL CART, THE PACKAGE OPEN MORE, AND STARTED TO EMIT VISIBLE FUMES. FACILITY CALLED OUTSIDE RESPONDER.

item.title: Report E-2023090602
item.description:
Report E-2023090602

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it is discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of test paper cement (un1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal 128 ounce can had released 10 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.description:
Report X-2023090312

  • City: CHAMPAIGN

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, ALL BOTTLES HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: ALL BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2023090103
item.description:
Report X-2023090103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RMP RESPONDED TO THE SPILL WEARING FULL P.P.E. WITH THE SPILL CART AND DECISION TREE. THEY NOTICED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID STICKER. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A FLAMMABLE LIQUID THEY CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND CLEANED THE AREA USING ZEP ZORBENT. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED 2 1 GALLON BOTTLES WHERE IN THE PACKAGE AND ONE 1GALLON BOTTLE HAD SHATTERED CAUSING THE LEAK. THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2023081943
item.description:
Report X-2023081943

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing a plastic bottle of nitric acid. The box was stained and wet from the bottle having a loose cap and spilled, cap was basically opened when inspected. Had inner packaging inside, could have been mishandled but cannot confirm. DescribePack: Box had big spill stains all over box on top and sides. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing 6 metal cans of acetone. The box was stained with dried acetone spill from one can that had a loose cap and spilled almost all of liquid. Cans are dented and stained from acetone and also had no inner packaging. DescribePack: Box had spill dried up and dark satins around it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag inside a plastic bin with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023081644
item.description:
Report X-2023081644

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WITH CLOSURES OPEN. UPON INSPECTION, ONE CAN HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE/MISSING CAP. FOURTEEN CANS WERE PRESENT, THERE MIGHT BE OTHER CANS MISSING. PACKAGE CONTAINED. DescribePack: ONE CAN LEAKED FROM LOOSE/MISSING CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED.
